newsitem.title: USA: Diana says talks end to sell APC unit.
newsitem.headline: Diana says talks end to sell APC unit.

text.p: Diana Corp said Wednesday that all previous negotiations and agreements with third parties for the possible sale of its APC unit were terminated.
As previously reported, Diana continues to weigh strategic alternatives and hopes to to have "some definitive results" on a restructuring plan before the end of November.

"While no decisions have yet been made, the objective of any restructuring would be to make Sattel Communications a 'pure play' by separating it from Diana's other susidiaries," Richard Fisher, chairman, said in a statement.

Diana owns 95 percent of Sattel, which supplies telecommunications equipment to public switched telephone networks, Internet service providers, local and long distance carriers, systems integrators and interconnect companies.
"There can be no assurances that any such transaction will take place, nor can there be any assurances as to the timing or value of any such transaction," Fisher added.
Diana added that APC wil be included in its restructuring plan, but gave no further details.

Earlier, Diana reported a net loss for the first quarter ended July 20 of $0.27 a share, compared with a loss of $0.10. Fisher said the loss widened due primarily to startup costs incurred by Sattel, a slight loss at its C&L Communications Corp unit and increased losses at APC.

Sales for the quarter rose to $87.2 million from $81.6 milion due primarily to sales of telecommunications equipment by Sattel, installation and service of voice and data networks by Valley Communications, and increased sales at C&L Communications.
